sub_genres.name: Fairy Tales
sub_genres.description: Recorded for children with or without background music.

sub_genres.name: Folktales
sub_genres.description: Traditional stories passed down throughout many generations.

sub_genres.name: Guided Meditation
sub_genres.description: Practice wherein an instructor guides the listener through the process of meditation throughout a session.

sub_genres.name: Interview
sub_genres.description: Recording of a specific person/s during a formal conversation arranged for historical archiving or media broadcast, often in a question and answer format in which the interviewee shares their views and personal anecdotes with the audience.

sub_genres.name: Lectures
sub_genres.description: Oral presentation with the intention to educate the audience on a specific topic.

sub_genres.name: Poetry
sub_genres.description: Encompasses many forms of literature that use style and rhythm to evoke ideas and emotions further than the prosaic meaning of the literature itself.

sub_genres.name: Radio Drama
sub_genres.description: Narrative storytelling performed by voice actors and produced for radio broadcasting or published on audio media such as tapes or CDs.

sub_genres.name: Speeches
sub_genres.description: Rhetorical acts performed publicly wherein a speaker typically monologues around a particular topic.

sub_genres.name: Stand-Up Comedy
sub_genres.description: Comedy where the performer speaks directly to their intended audience, with origins beginning in the late 19th century.
